alert.note: Alert for Champaign; Delaware; Logan; Union (Ohio) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 24 at 6:30PM EDT by NWS Wilmington
info.description: ...RAPIDLY DEVELOPING THUNDERSTORMS WILL IMPACT PORTIONS OF NORTHEASTERN CHAMPAIGN AND SOUTHEASTERN LOGAN COUNTIES IN WEST CENTRAL OHIO, CENTRAL DELAWARE AND SOUTHERN UNION COUNTIES IN CENTRAL OHIO THROUGH 700 PM EDT... At 630 PM EDT, rapidly developing thunderstorms were located along a line extending from near Sunbury to near North Lewisburg, moving east at 10 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 40 mph, nickel size hail, and very heavy rain. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Hail may cause minor damage to outdoor objects. Visibility will be poor and hydroplaning is possible. Locations impacted include... Delaware, Marysville, Powell, Sunbury, West Liberty, North Lewisburg, New California, Milford Center, Galena, Ostrander, Woodstock, Unionville Center, Cable, Alum Creek State Park, Olive Green, State Route 4 at State Route 161, US Route 33 at US Route 42, Warrensburg, Pottersburg and Kennard. This includes I-71 in Ohio between mile markers 126 and 138. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.88 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a sturdy building. Motorists should slow down and use extra caution. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 1000 PM EDT for central and west central Ohio. To report hazardous weather conditions, go to our website at weather.gov/iln and submit your report via social media, when you can do so safely.
